spoon verb
(USE A SPOON)
[ T + adv/prep ] to move something, especially food, using a spoon: He spooned the mush into the baby's open mouth. Spoon a little sauce over the fish.

spoon verb
(LIE TOGETHER)
I or T (of two people) to lie with their bodies against each other, facing the same direction; to lie against someone with your body facing in the same direction as theirs: "I saw them spooning on the beach," she added, rather wistfully. Spoon her and let her fall asleep in your arms.
